meanings.definition: A hormone that regulates sleep and wakefulness.
meanings.sent1: The melatonins help our bodies know when it's time to sleep or wake up.
meanings.sent2: I take melatonins to help me fall asleep faster at night.
meanings.sent3: The melatonins in my body must be confused because I keep waking up in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent4: Her natural ability to sleep soundly is like having a surplus of melatonins in her system.
meanings.sent5: The melatonins act like a gentle lullaby, coaxing us into a peaceful slumber.

meanings.definition: Synthetic versions of the hormone melatonin used as a supplement to improve sleep.
meanings.sent1: Some people find relief from insomnia by taking synthetic melatonins before bed.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended melatonins to help regulate my sleep patterns.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally took too many melatonins and ended up sleeping through my alarm.
meanings.sent4: The synthetic melatonins are like little sleep helpers that guide you to dreamland.
meanings.sent5: Each pill of melatonins is a tiny key that unlocks a restful night's sleep.
